radiographic_examinations.findings: The common bile duct is significantly dilated measuring up to 1.2 cm, tapering smoothly distally at the level of the ampulla without a discrete obstructing mass. No gallstones are seen. Mild central intrahepatic duct dilatation with no identified cause. Normal liver contour with a 6 mm hamartoma in segment VII. Geographic areas of hypoperfusion in segment IVb. No concerning liver lesions, patent portal and hepatic veins, normal pancreatic signal intensity, incidental pancreas divisum, bilateral simple renal cysts with the largest measuring 7.9 x 9.1 cm, and a tiny amount of fluid adjacent to the spleen.
